metadata.title: RBI Grade B - General Awareness Practice Set 4
instructions: This practice set contains 30 General Awareness questions
Each question has 5 options (A, B, C, D, E)
No negative marking in practice mode

questions.question: What was the policy repo rate maintained by the Monetary Policy Committee in its meetings between October 2023 and February 2024?
questions.explanation: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.50 per cent through H2:2023-24 to align inflation with the target while supporting growth. (Page 12)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In a risk scenario where the Indian Rupee (INR) depreciates by 5 per cent over the baseline, what is the estimated impact on domestic inflation and GDP growth?

options.A: Inflation rises by 50 bps and GDP growth falls by 25 bps
options.B: Inflation rises by 35 bps and GDP growth rises by 25 bps
options.C: Inflation falls by 35 bps and GDP growth falls by 25 bps
options.D: Inflation rises by 25 bps and GDP growth rises by 35 bps

questions.explanation: The report's analysis on the balance of risks indicates that if the INR depreciates by 5 per cent over the baseline, inflation could rise by around 35 bps while GDP growth could benefit by around 25 bps through the trade channel. (Page 22-23)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In October 2025, how much additional tax devolution was released by the Union Government to State Governments to enable them to accelerate capital spending ahead of the festive season?
questions.explanation: On 1st October 2025, the Union Government released an additional tax devolution of ₹1,01,603 crore to State Governments to accelerate capital spending and finance development expenditure.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the total amount of gold held by the Reserve Bank of India as of March 31, 2024?
questions.explanation: As on March 31, 2024, the total gold held by the Reserve Bank was 822.10 metric tonnes, an increase from 794.63 metric tonnes on March 31, 2023. (Page 261, Para ii and Table XII.4)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In September 2025, the Japanese credit rating agency, Rating and Investment Information, Inc. (R&I), upgraded India's long-term sovereign credit rating to what level?
questions.explanation: Rating and Investment Information, Inc. (R&I) of Japan upgraded India’s long-term sovereign credit rating to ‘BBB+’ from ‘BBB’, while retaining the “Stable” Outlook for the Indian economy.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the projected real GDP growth for the Indian economy for the financial year 2024-25?
questions.explanation: Taking into account various domestic economic factors, the real GDP growth for 2024-25 is projected at 7.0 per cent with risks evenly balanced. (Page 34, para I.38)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Following the Monetary Policy Committee meeting in April 2025, what was the new policy repo rate set at?
questions.explanation: The Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) unanimously voted to reduce the policy repo rate by 25 basis points to 6.00 per cent with immediate effect. (Page 7)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the amendment to Section 140B, what is the additional income-tax payable if an updated return is filed after the expiry of twenty-four months but before thirty-six months from the end of the relevant assessment year?
questions.explanation: A new clause (iii) is inserted in Section 140B(3) which prescribes that sixty per cent of the aggregate of tax and interest payable shall be the additional income-tax if the updated return is furnished after twenty-four months but before thirty-six months from the end of the relevant assessment year. (Page 50, 158)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The BRICS bloc underwent a significant expansion in March 2025. Based on the provided list, which of the following countries was NOT among the new members that joined the group?
questions.explanation: The expansion of BRICS in March 2025 included Saudi Arabia, UAE, Egypt, Ethiopia, and Iran. Argentina was not mentioned as one of the new members in the provided text.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In its June 2025 monetary policy review, the RBI maintained the repo rate at 6.75%. Which of the following economic indicators from the preceding month (May 2025) likely supported this decision to hold rates steady?

options.A: Manufacturing PMI reaching 58.5, highest in 15 months

questions.explanation: The decision to hold the repo rate in June 2025 was likely influenced by the easing of Wholesale Price Index (WPI) inflation to 3.2% in May 2025, which suggested that inflationary pressures were moderating, reducing the immediate need for a rate hike.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Which of the following statements about the recommendations from the 56th GST Council meeting is INCORRECT?

options.A: GST on all individual life and health insurance policies is to be exempted.
options.B: The GST rate on manmade fibre is to be reduced from 18% to 5%.
options.C: A uniform GST rate of 18% is proposed for all auto parts irrespective of their HS code.
options.D: GST on small cars and motorcycles equal to or below 350cc is reduced from 28% to 18%.
options.E: The 4-tiered tax rate structure is rationalised into a 3-rate structure with rates of 5%, 18%, and 28%.

questions.explanation: The GST Council recommended rationalising the 4-tiered tax rate structure into a citizen-friendly ‘Simple Tax’ - a 2-rate structure with a Standard Rate of 18% and a Merit Rate of 5%, plus a special de-merit rate of 40%. The statement about a 3-rate structure of 5%, 18%, and 28% is incorrect.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The report notes a 'paradoxical' situation where banks simultaneously placed substantial funds under the Standing Deposit Facility (SDF) while borrowing heavily from the Marginal Standing Facility (MSF). What key measure was introduced by the RBI effective December 30, 2023, to address this and improve fund management?

options.A: The spread between MSF and SDF rates was increased.
options.B: A penal charge was introduced for using both facilities on the same day.
options.C: Reversal of liquidity facilities under both SDF and MSF was permitted even on weekends and holidays.
options.D: The borrowing limit under MSF was reduced for banks using the SDF facility.
options.E: Banks were mandated to choose only one of the two facilities on any given day.

questions.explanation: To address the paradoxical situation of simultaneous high usage of both SDF and MSF and to enable better fund management, the RBI decided to allow the reversal of liquidity facilities under both SDF and MSF even during weekends and holidays, effective from December 30, 2023. (Page 113, Para III.22)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In a sensitivity analysis scenario involving a parallel upward shift of 250 bps in the yield curve, what would be the estimated reduction in the system-level Capital to Risk-weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) and how many foreign banks would breach the regulatory minimum of 9%?

options.A: A reduction of 77 bps in CRAR, with two foreign banks breaching the minimum.
options.B: A reduction of 114 bps in CRAR, with four foreign banks breaching the minimum.
options.C: A reduction of 115 bps in CRAR, with four foreign banks breaching the minimum.
options.D: A reduction of 318 bps in CRAR, with no banks breaching the minimum.
options.E: A reduction of 608 bps in CRAR, with all foreign banks breaching the minimum.

questions.explanation: It is assessed that a parallel upward shift of 250 bps in the yield curve on the fair-valued portfolio (AFS and FVTPL) would reduce the system-level CRAR by 114 bps. At a disaggregated level, this major shock would cause four foreign banks' CRAR to fall below the regulatory minimum of 9 per cent. (Page 97)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Gross Non-Performing Assets (GNPA) ratio of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) as of September 2024, which was noted as a 12-year low?
questions.explanation: The asset quality of Scheduled Commercial Banks (SCBs) improved significantly, with their Gross Non-Performing Assets (GNPA) ratio declining to a 12-year low of 2.6 per cent in September 2024. (Page 80)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: To bolster depositor confidence, the government increased deposit insurance coverage in April 2025. What is the new coverage limit, and what was the total bank deposit base in India as of September 2025?
questions.explanation: In April 2025, the government raised the deposit insurance coverage from ₹5 lakh to ₹10 lakh per depositor. This strengthened a banking sector whose total deposits grew to ₹205 lakh crore by September 2025, reflecting robust public trust.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Atal Pension Yojana (APY), a flagship social security scheme, surpassed how many gross enrolments as of July 2025?
questions.explanation: As per the press release from the Ministry of Finance, the Atal Pension Yojana (APY) achieved a significant milestone by surpassing 8 crore total gross enrolments as of July 2025.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the projected real GDP growth for the financial year 2025-26 as per the April 2025 Monetary Policy Statement?
questions.explanation: Taking all factors into consideration, the real GDP growth for 2025-26 is projected at 6.5 per cent, with quarterly breakdowns of Q1 at 6.5%, Q2 at 6.7%, Q3 at 6.6%, and Q4 at 6.3%. (Page 9)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the surcharge rate on income tax for a co-operative society with a total income exceeding one crore rupees but not exceeding ten crore rupees?
questions.explanation: For every co-operative society, the surcharge on income tax is calculated at the rate of seven per cent if the total income exceeds one crore rupees but does not exceed ten crore rupees. (Page 13, 120)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Government of India launched the PM Vishwakarma scheme in November 2024 to support traditional artisans and craftspeople. What was the total financial outlay allocated for this scheme?
questions.explanation: The PM Vishwakarma scheme, launched in November 2024, was introduced with a substantial financial allocation of ₹13,000 crore to uplift traditional artisans.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As on March 22, 2024, what was the money multiplier (MM)?
questions.explanation: As on March 22, 2024, the money multiplier (MM) was 5.4, which was marginally higher than its decennial average of 5.3 (2013-14 to 2023-24). (Page 72, para II.4.11; Page 73, Table II.4.1)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In March 2025, India signed a Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement with which of the following economic blocs?
questions.explanation: After extensive negotiations, India signed a Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement with the European Union in March 2025, aiming to boost bilateral trade and investment.
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What policy repo rate was maintained by the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) of the RBI during its meetings in the first nine months of FY25 (April-December 2024)?
questions.explanation: During the first nine months of FY25 (April 2024-December 2024), the Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) of the RBI decided to keep the policy repo rate unchanged at 6.5 per cent. (Page 81)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the Economic Survey 2023-24, what was the estimated real GDP growth rate for the financial year 2024 (FY24)?
questions.explanation: The preface of the Economic Survey 2023-24 states on page 8, 'In May, we learnt that the Indian economy is estimated to have grown 8.2% in real terms in FY24.'
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the macro stress tests for credit risk, what is the projected Capital to Risk-weighted Assets Ratio (CRAR) for Scheduled Commercial Banks by March 2025 under a severe stress scenario?
questions.explanation: The macro stress test results project that the aggregate CRAR of 46 major banks may go down to 13.0 per cent under the severe stress scenario by March 2025, which is still above the minimum capital requirement of 9 per cent. (Page 85)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Arrange the following sectors in descending order of their share in total FDI equity inflows during H1 of FY25: 1. Computer software and hardware 2. Services Sector 3. Trading 4. Non-conventional energy
questions.explanation: In H1 of FY25, the Services sector was the largest recipient of FDI (19.1%), followed by computer software and hardware (14.1%), trading (9.1%), and non-conventional energy (7.0%). (Page 152, Para 3.51 & Chart III.15)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the official theme of the Swachhata Hi Seva (SHS) Campaign 2025, launched by the Department of Financial Services?
questions.explanation: The Department of Financial Services launched Swachhata Hi Seva 2025 (SHS 2025), a nationwide cleanliness campaign scheduled from September 17 to October 2, 2025. This year's theme is 'Swachhotsav', blending festive celebrations with cleanliness.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: By the end of March 2025, the Central Bank Digital Currency-Retail (e₹-R) pilot had been expanded to how many banks and users respectively?
questions.explanation: As at end-March 2025, the pilot program for the e₹-R segment was expanded to include 17 banks and 60 lakh users since its inception in December 2022. (Page 34)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What baseline assumption for the price of the Indian basket of crude oil was used for projections for 2025-26?
questions.explanation: The baseline assumption for crude price (Indian basket) is reduced to US$ 70 per barrel during 2025-26, as stated in the April 2025 MPR. (Page 14, Table I.2)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was India's real Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth projected at for the financial year 2024-25?
questions.explanation: Real gross domestic product (GDP) for India is projected to grow at 6.6 per cent in 2024-25, supported by a revival in rural consumption and strong services exports. (Page 24)
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the RBI's OBICUS survey, what was the seasonally adjusted capacity utilisation (CU) in manufacturing firms in Q2 FY25?
questions.explanation: The RBI’s Order Books, Inventory, and Capacity Utilisation Survey (OBICUS) showed that the seasonally adjusted capacity utilisation (CU) in manufacturing firms was 74.7 per cent in Q2 FY25, which is above the long-term average of 73.8 per cent. (Page 64, Para 1.40)
questions.subject: General_Awareness
